verses.kjv: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.
verses.ct: Rescue me, God, because the waters have risen up to my soul.

verses.kjv: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.
verses.ct: I'm sinking in deep mud with nothing solid to stand on. I've gone into deep waters, and the currents are sweeping over me.

verses.kjv: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.
verses.ct: I'm exhausted from crying out. My throat is raw. My eyes are giving out as I wait for my God.

verses.kjv: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.
verses.ct: Those who hate me for no reason outnumber the hairs on my head. My enemies who want to destroy me are powerful, and they have no just cause. I'm forced to give back what I never stole.

verses.kjv: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.
verses.ct: God, you know how foolish I've been, and my sins aren't hidden from you.

verses.kjv: Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord GOD of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.
verses.ct: Don't let those who put their hope in you be disgraced because of me, Lord GOD of armies. Don't let those who seek you be humiliated on my account, God of Israel.

verses.kjv: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.
verses.ct: It's because of you that I've endured insults; shame has covered my face.

verses.kjv: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother’s children.
verses.ct: I've become an outsider to my own brothers, a foreigner to my own mother's children.

verses.kjv: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.
verses.ct: Passion for your house has consumed me, and the insults of those who mock you have fallen on me.

verses.kjv: When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.
verses.ct: When I wept and disciplined myself with fasting, it only brought me more ridicule.

verses.kjv: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.
verses.ct: When I put on rough cloth as my clothing, I became a joke to them.

verses.kjv: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.
verses.ct: Those who sit at the city gate gossip about me, and drunkards make up songs mocking me.

verses.kjv: But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O LORD, in an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.
verses.ct: But my prayer comes to you, LORD, at the right time. God, in your abundant mercy, answer me with the certainty of your salvation.

verses.kjv: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.
verses.ct: Pull me out of the mud and don't let me sink. Rescue me from those who hate me and from these deep waters.

verses.kjv: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
verses.ct: Don't let the floodwaters sweep over me, or the depths swallow me, or the pit close its mouth over me.

verses.kjv: Hear me, O LORD; for thy lovingkindness is good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.
verses.ct: Answer me, LORD, because your faithful love is good. In your abundant compassion, turn toward me.

verses.kjv: And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.
verses.ct: Don't withdraw your favor from your servant, because I'm in distress. Answer me quickly!

verses.kjv: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.
verses.ct: Come near to my soul and set it free. Rescue me because of my enemies.

verses.kjv: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.
verses.ct: You know the insults, the shame, and the disgrace I've suffered. Every one of my opponents is known to you.

verses.kjv: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.
verses.ct: Insults have shattered my heart, and I'm overwhelmed with grief. I looked for someone to show compassion, but no one did. I searched for someone to comfort me, but found no one.

verses.kjv: They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
verses.ct: Instead, they put poison in my food, and when I was thirsty, they gave me vinegar to drink.

verses.kjv: Let their table become a snare before them: and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap.
verses.ct: Let their own table become a trap in front of them, and what should bring them security become a snare.

verses.kjv: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.
verses.ct: Let their eyes grow so dark they cannot see, and make their bodies tremble constantly.

verses.kjv: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.
verses.ct: Pour out your fury on them, and let your burning anger overtake them.

verses.kjv: Let their habitation be desolate; and let none dwell in their tents.
verses.ct: Let their homes be abandoned, and let no one live in their camps.

verses.kjv: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.
verses.ct: They persecute the one you have already struck, and they add to the pain of those you have wounded.

verses.kjv: Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.
verses.ct: Pile guilt upon their guilt, and never let them share in your righteousness.

verses.kjv: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.
verses.ct: Erase them from the book of the living, and don't let them be recorded alongside the righteous.

verses.kjv: But I am poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.
verses.ct: But I am suffering and in pain. Let your salvation, God, lift me to safety.

verses.kjv: I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.
verses.ct: I will praise God's name with a song and honor him with thanksgiving.

verses.kjv: This also shall please the LORD better than an ox or bullock that hath horns and hoofs.
verses.ct: This will please the LORD more than an ox, more than a bull with horns and hooves.

verses.kjv: The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.
verses.ct: The humble will see this and be glad. You who seek God — let your hearts be revived!

verses.kjv: For the LORD heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.
verses.ct: The LORD listens to those in need and does not look down on his prisoners.

verses.kjv: Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.
verses.ct: Let heaven and earth praise him, the seas and everything that moves in them.

verses.kjv: For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.
verses.ct: God will save Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah so that people may settle there and possess it.

verses.kjv: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.
verses.ct: The descendants of his servants will inherit it, and those who love his name will make their home there.
